alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:25PM CDT until May 29 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. .Heavy rainfall is causing multiple rivers and creeks to flow over their banks. For the Driftwood Creek...including McCook 4sw...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 11.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 08/09/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
